cs445.a1

Interface ProfileInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public interface ProfileInterface
extends java.io.Serializable
    ProfileInterface describes a social media profile. It stores a user's name, "about me" blurb, and a set of profiles that the user follows. It can also suggest new profiles to follow based on the "followers of followers" technique.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String newName)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets this profile's name.

        If newName is not null, then setName modifies this profile so that its name is newName. If newName is null, then setName throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the profile, for example:

        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Name cannot be null")

        Parameters:
        newName - The new name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If newName is null

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets this profile's name.
        Returns:
        The name

      • setAbout

        void setAbout(java.lang.String newAbout)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets this profile's "about me" blurb.

        If newAbout is not null, then setAbout modifies this profile so that its about blurb is newAbout. If newAbout is null, then setAbout throws IllegalArgumentException without modifying the profile.

        Parameters:
        newAbout - The new blurb
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If newAbout is null

      • getAbout

        java.lang.String getAbout()
        Gets this profile's "about me" blurb
        Returns:
        The blurb

      • follow

        boolean follow(ProfileInterface other)
        Adds another profile to this profile's following set.

        If this profile's following set is at capacity, or if other is null, then follow returns false without modifying the profile. Otherwise, other is added to this profile's following set.

        Parameters:
        other - The profile to follow
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise

      • unfollow

        boolean unfollow(ProfileInterface other)
        Removes the specified profile from this profile's following set.

        If this profile's following set does not contain other, or if other is null, then unfollow returns false without modifying the profile. Otherwise, this profile in modified in such a way that other is removed from this profile's following set.

        Parameters:
        other - The profile to follow
        Returns:
        True if successful, false otherwise

      • following

        ProfileInterface[] following(int howMany)
        Returns a preview of this profile's following set.

        The howMany parameter is a maximum desired size. The returned array may be less than the requested size if this profile is following fewer than howMany other profiles. Clients of this method must be careful to check the size of the returned array to avoid ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

        Specifically, following returns an array of size min(howMany, [number of profiles that this profile is following]). This array is populated with arbitrary profiles that this profile follows.

        Parameters:
        howMany - The maximum number of profiles to return
        Returns:
        An array of size ≤howMany, containing profiles that this profile follows

      • recommend

        ProfileInterface recommend()
        Recommends a profile for this profile to follow. This returns a profile followed by one of this profile's followed profiles. Should not recommend this profile to follow someone they already follow, and should not recommend to follow oneself.

        For example, if this profile is Alex, and Alex follows Bart, and Bart follows Crissy, this method might return Crissy.

        Returns:
        The profile to suggest, or null if no suitable profile is possible.
